lines.text: Leonard, when will you learn? Everybody does bad things. Everybody has something hidden. Everybody.

[Frustrated with the lack of co-operation]
Look, for the strong, silent type I go to the movies. From you I desire only a statement.
Look, give us a break, will yuh?

[Sarcastically]
She was hit by a flying saucer.

[to Lois in the malt shop as the school kids are dancing]
Kids! You know, if you could harness all this energy, you could run our power plant for a year.

[to Lois]
I've got plenty of sense. I know this school isn't big enough to hold us both. It's either you or me, and all I care about is me.

[Rhetorically]
Is it a crime to strangle a principal?
You can lie about a lot of things, but fingerprints don't lie.
Leonard, you have your mother's eyes... especially when you're telling a lie.

[to Lois at police headquarters]
Miss Conway, tell him to leave me alone.
You're not in school now. Miss Conway can't do anything.

[Sarcastically]
You've lost me my job, my reputation, and most of my friends. What would you like me to do for you, Leonard.
